tiledbsoma 0.0.0.9010

Iterator-Style Access to SOMA Array via SOMAReader

Source: R/RcppExports.R
sr_setup.Rd

The sr_* functions provide low-level access to an instance of the SOMAReader class so that iterative access over parts of a (large) array is possible.

sr_setup

instantiates and by default also submits a query

sr_complete

checks if more data is available

sr_next

returns the next chunk

sr_setup(
  ctx,
  uri,
  colnames = NULL,
  qc = NULL,
  dim_points = NULL,
  dim_ranges = NULL,
  config = NULL,
  loglevel = "auto"
)

sr_complete(sr)

sr_next(sr)

Arguments

ctx

An external pointer to a TileDB Context object

uri

Character value with URI path to a SOMA data set

colnames

Optional vector of character value with the name of the columns to retrieve

qc

Optional external Pointer object to TileDB Query Condition, defaults to ‘NULL’ i.e. no query condition

dim_points

Optional named list with vector of data points to select on the given dimension(s). Each dimension can be one entry in the list.

dim_ranges

Optional named list with two-column matrix where each row select a range for the given dimension. Each dimension can be one entry in the list.

config

Optional named chracter vector with ‘key’ and ‘value’ pairs used as TileDB config parameters. If unset default configuration is used.

loglevel

Character value with the desired logging level, defaults to ‘auto’ which lets prior setting prevail, any other value is set as new logging level.

sr

An external pointer to a TileDB SOMAReader object

Value

sr_setup returns an external pointer to a SOMAReader. sr_complete

returns a boolean, and sr_next returns an Arrow array helper object.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
ctx <- tiledb_ctx()
uri <- "test/soco/pbmc3k_processed/obs"
sr <- sr_setup(ctx@ptr, uri, "warn")
rl <- data.frame()
while (nrow(rl) == 0 || !tiledbsoma:::sr_complete(sr)) {
    dat <- tiledbsoma:::sr_next(sr)
    dat |>
        arch::from_arch_array(arrow::RecordBatch) |>
        arrow::as_arrow_table() |>
        collect() |>
        as.data.frame() |>
        data.table() -> D
    rl <- rbind(rl, D)
}
summary(rl)
}
